revised_title: Edmund Halley's Observations on the Latitudes of Stars and the Change of the Obliquity of the Ecliptic
tldr: Edmund Halley examines the latitudes of fixed stars as recorded by ancient astronomers and compares them to modern observations. He finds discrepancies in the latitudes of certain stars, suggesting a change in the obliquity of the Ecliptic over time. Halley raises questions about the accuracy of ancient observations and the potential for stars to have their own motions.
